thread.title: Collette Dinnigan hits Sydney’s ALDI store as thousands flock to get their hands on kids’ wear
thread.title_full: Collette Dinnigan hits Sydney’s ALDI store as thousands flock to get their hands on kids’ wear | DailyTelegraph

author: Elle Halliwell
title: Collette Dinnigan hits Sydney’s ALDI store as thousands flock to get their hands on kids’ wear
text:
SYDNEY mums have given Collette Dinnigan’s range for ALDI the thumbs up, with thousands flocking to the supermarket today to snap up her Young Hearts range.
Shoppers began lining up outside ALDI Canterbury from 7.30am to be the first to purchase the limited edition range of toddler and children’s wear created by the esteemed designer.
The range sparked a frenzy among mums and grandmothers, snapping up the range of dresses, hats, pants, skirts and tops by the armload.
Collette Dinnigan's ALDI children's wear launches in store this morning. Picture: Stephen Cooper For mum of one Rebecca Prestia, it was an opportunity to dress her six-month-old daughter Angelina in designer threads for a fraction of the price.
The Young Hearts collection in Aldi priced from $11.99 - $29.99. Young Hearts is an exclusive collaboration between ALDI and Collette Dinnigan. Picture: Hugh Stewart. “I can’t say I’ve bought a lot of her stuff but this looked pretty online so I thought I’d try it out,” The Croydon Park resident told The Daily Telegraph. She bought six pieces from the range including swimwear, hats and a summer dress.
“To put it in a supermarket and make it affordable so people can access it easily is great.”

Sydney Confidential 0 comments Terror threats: ‘Thousands will die’ National Chloe: I’m not used to the fame Sydney Confidential 0 comments Knights sign half, Raiders re-sign centre Nrl 0 comments Esquire names the sexiest woman alive Books 0 comments COUNCILLOR AND MP BICKER OVER ALDI SITE RE-ZONING
Collette Dinnigan's ALDI children's wear launches in store this morning. Picture: Stephen Cooper Miranda Kerr wearing a Collette Dinnigan dress with designer Collette Dinnigan on the catwalk. Fellow shopper Cath McCarthy hoped the supermarket chain planned to offer more collections by the designer in the future.
“I love Collette Dinnigan but can’t usually afford her so we saw this in the paper and decided to check it out; have a little splurge,” she said.
The company expects the range will sell out in the next few days.
